Maine Township High School District 207
August 4 at 1:21 PM ·

After careful review and consideration, the district leadership team is recommending to the Board of Education that we slow the start of in-person school at the beginning of the year through the end of the first quarter.

Parents should know that “at home” learning will look much different than it looked in the spring as students will be required to attend class following their class schedule during their school day; students will earn grades as they would in a traditional classroom setting; students will be able to be on campus if they choose at times during “at home” learning; and the schools will hold in-person orientations for each grade level in the first few weeks of school to help students transition to this very different school year and learning environment.

There is a detailed plan available that shares key information and answers many parent questions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xu6EhJu2K4THxzlHxFcXd0LpPuNi9OKZLaZcBdUbX0A/edit?usp=sharing

There is a detailed plan available that shares key information and answers many parent questions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xu6EhJu2K4THxzlHxFcXd0LpPuNi9OKZLaZcBdUbX0A/edit?usp=sharing
